content:
Connectathon 28 Advance Directive Interoperability stream (Connectathon 28 - September 13-15, 2021)
https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2021+-+09+Connectathon+28
@Lorraine Wickiser @Maria D Moen @Matt Elrod @Tina Wilkins @Lynda Hoeksema @Jessica Skopac @Lisa Nelson @Dave Hill

Track Kick Off Meeting: Wednesday September 8, 2021, 1.30-3.30pm ET Join ZoomGov Meeting
https://mitre.zoomgov.com/j/1609856747

Meeting ID: 160 985 6747
One tap mobile
+16692545252,,1609856747# US (San Jose)
+16468287666,,1609856747# US (New York)

+1 669 254 5252 US (San Jose)
+1 646 828 7666 US (New York)

Find your local number: https://mitre.zoomgov.com/u/ad2s7448xn

Join by SIP
1609856747@sip.zoomgov.com

Join by H.323
161.199.138.10 (US West)
161.199.136.10 (US East)
Meeting ID: 160 985 6747

We are excited to test the PACIO Advance Directive Interoperability (ADI) IG at the Connectathon today. If you have already not reached out to the track leads about your plans to bring a server or client, please reach out to track lead @Corey Spears soon. Most of the connection points are open, and we also have another one that requires authentication in which we need to provision testers. Other track leads are @Maria D Moen @Tina Wilkins or @Matt Elrod . Excited to do some good testing!

ConMan contains 3 references to the ADI IG, we've requested the Administrator remove older versions. The correct PACIO ADI IG is labeled "PACIO Advance Directive Interoperability Implementation Guide".
http://conman.clinfhir.com/connectathon.html?event=con28

@Matt Elrod is hosting a FHIR Digital Signature Discussion on 9/15 at 3.00PM ET. Everyone is welcome to join!
This will be hosted outside of the Connectathon via GoToMeeting.
Please join from your computer, tablet or smartphone.
https://global.gotomeeting.com/join/421214325

You can also dial in using your phone.
United States: +1 (408) 650-3123
Access Code: 421-214-325
Are there notes on the signature discussion?

I don't happen to have any notes, though we did walk through a presentation. https://confluence.hl7.org/download/attachments/118981523/DigitalSignatureOptions_20210917%20%20-%20%20Read-Only.pptx?version=1&modificationDate=1632445263619&api=v2

We identified 3 options. 2 in the presentation (embedded Signature & Standalone signature document) and 1 that is being used by the VCI (enveloping). Currently it looks like the stand alone signature best meets our use case in the flexibility it provides, the level of assurance of the data contained within, and compatibility with HIEs.

Corey, that solution that best meets your use-case... is that the one I mentioned as being the Document Digital Signature implementation guide from IHE. For others benefit, here is an article I wrote on the topic https://healthcaresecprivacy.blogspot.com/2021/08/fhir-document-digital-signatures.html
